Djibouti to US Immigration Fact Sheet

2022-12-14

This is an automatically generated report on immigration from Djibouti to the United States of America using data from the US State Department and the US Department of Homeland Security.

Visa Statistics from the US State Department

Nonimmigrant Visas

For Fiscal Year 2021 there were 125 nonimmigrant visas issued for Djibouti, compared to a global average of 13,960 nonimmigrant visas issued per country. This represents a 14% change from the previous fiscal year.

From 2022-07-01 to 2021-08-01 there were 112 immigrant visas issued for Djibouti compared to a global average of 2,409 immigrant visas per country over the same time period.

Refugees and Asylum Seekers

Moving on the refugees and asylees (asylum seekers), in FY 2020 there were new refugee arrivals and 40 new asylees. The primary difference between refugees and asylees is that refugees are not currently in the US while asylees are either already in the US or at a point of entry. Among asylees, 34 were affirmative asylees, who had proactively applied for asylum, and 6 were defensive asylees, meaning they are currently in removal proceedings in an immigration court.

Sometimes immigrants, legal or otherwise, must be removed from their host country. In FY 2020, 3 people from Djibouti were determined inadmissible, meaning they were not approved to enter the US. A further were apprehended within the US on suspicion of being there illegally, of which were removed for non-criminal charges and were removed on criminal charges, with the remainder either released on still awaiting a final decision.
